newsitem.title: UK: Britain calls for candour on millennium software.
newsitem.headline: Britain calls for candour on millennium software.

text.p: Computer companies still selling software that will not cope with the millennium date change must come clean with their customers, a British minister said on Friday.
"Computer companies still selling non-millennium-compliant software and services must come clean and make the position clear to the customer," said Science and Technology Minister Ian Taylor.

Most computer systems abbreviate the year to the last two digits. When the year 2000 arrives, many will interpret "00" as 1900 instead of 2000. This could create enormous problems in all areas of business and cost millions of pounds (dollars) to correct.
"I warn that anyone in business who fails to face up to these challenges now could be exposed to severe and costly repercussions," Taylor told a business conference.
"It's not only single companies' own systems which must be millennium ready, but also all the systems that must link together in communicating between suppliers, manufacturers, carriers and buyers."
